Anime¶

class Sakurajima.models.base_models.Anime(data_dict: dict, network, api_url: str)¶

Wraps all the relevant data for an anime like anime_id (called as detail_id by AniWatch backend), title, airing date etc. Use the get_episodes method to get a list of available episodes

add_recommendation(recommended_anime_id: int)¶

Adds the user’s reccomendation for the anime.

Parameters

recommended_anime_id (int) – The aniwatch anime ID of the anime you want to recommend.

Returns

[description]

Return type

[type]

get_chronicle(page=1)¶

Gets the chronicle for the anime, a chronicle tracks the user’s watch history for a particular anime.

Parameters

page (int, optional) – The page of the chronicle you want to get, defaults to 1

Returns

A list of ChronicleEntry objects where each object has details like date.

Return type

list[ChronicleEntry]

get_complete_object()¶

Gets the current anime object but with complete attributes. Sometimes, the Anime object that is returned by the API does not contain values for all the attributes that the Anime object has. Use this method to get an object with the maximum amount of data. This method is almost never required but is for edge cases

Returns

An Anime object with values for as many attributes as possible.

Return type

Anime

get_dict()¶

Gets the JSON response in the form of a dictionary that was used to initialize the object.

Returns

A dictionary of the JSON response

Return type

dict

get_episodes()¶

Gets a list of all available episodes of the anime.

Returns

An EpisodeList object, an EpisodeList object is very similar to a normal list. You can access specific indexes using the “[]” syntax. In addition to this, an EpisodeList has few convinience methods like get_episode_by_number(episode_number) which returns an episode with the provided episode number.

Return type

EpisodeList

get_media()¶

Gets the anime’s associated media from aniwatch.me

Returns

A Media object that has attributes like opening, osts.

Return type

Media

get_recommendations()¶

Gets the recommendations for the anime.

Returns

A list of RecommendationEntry objects where each object represents a single recommendation.

Return type

list[RecommendationEntry]

get_relations()¶

Gets the relation of the anime.

Returns

A Relation object that contains all the details of the relation.

Return type

Relation

mark_as_completed()¶

Marks the anime as “completed” on the user’s aniwatch anime list.

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

mark_as_dropped()¶

Marks the anime as “dropped” on the user’s aniwatch anime list.

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

mark_as_on_hold()¶

Marks the anime as “on hold” on the user’s aniwatch anime list.

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

mark_as_plan_to_watch()¶

Marks the anime as “plan to watch” on the user’s aniwatch anime list.

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

mark_as_watching()¶

Marks the anime as “watching” on the user’s aniwatch anime list

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

rate(rating: int)¶

Set the user’s rating for the anime on aniwatch.

Parameters

rating (int) – The rating you want to set, should be between 1 to 10. Rate 0 to remove the user’s rating for the anime

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool

remove_from_list()¶

Removes the anime from the user’s aniwatch anime list.

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occurs.

Return type

bool
